title: Legend's night: Pele's exacting Kolkata night
text:
Football Legend's night: Pele's exacting Kolkata night Football legend Pele was felicitated by state chief minister Mamata Banerjee along with former India cricket captain Sourav Ganguly and two-time Academy award winning music composer AR Rahman. IndiaToday.in | New Delhi, October 12, 2015 | UPDATED 23:37 IST Mail A+ A- 
Football legend Edson Arantes do Nascimento (aka) Pele arrived in Kolkata on Sunday on a 3-day tour, more than 38 years after he charmed the City of Joy with his moves on the field. 
A grand felicitation ceremony titled "Legend's night" was held on Monday at Netaji Indoor stadium in Kolkata. Former India captain Sourav Ganguly, two-time Academy award winning music composer A R Rahman , West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, Mohun Bagan team members from 1977 and several other football enthusiasts were present to witness this grand occasion. 
Rahman, sang a few lines from the song Jai Ho, which fetched him the Oscar award as a dedication to the legend from Brazil. 
Pele was reunited with the Mohun Bagan's 'Class of 77 football team' which played a game against Pele's team New York Cosmos in 1977. The entire team were honoured by Pele and the players expressed their deepest gratitude in return. 
Speaking on this occasion Ganguly said: "Pressure is important to win games, if you have pressure you care a lot. In 1970 as a 17-year-old {Pele} had that pressure and that helps you to develop as great player." 
In an interview session Ganguly asked Pele what are the most important things that are required for a football country to become better? Pele in his inimical style explained that the players have to play games abroad to understand the techniques and that will help them to become professionals in future. 
The guests also celebrated the legend's birthday (Oct 26) in advance and made him cut a cake on the stage. Pele, who could barely stand up every time to greet a guest, thanked everyone who made his visit possible. On asked what makes a person a great player he said physique is not good enough, skills are also important. 
Asked about who will be his successor in future, he said there will be someone like him in every generation. In the current generation he named Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo as the greatest football players. 
The Brazilian was also asked about the current scenario of Indian football and he graciously said he was there to help Indian footballers. 
The greatest football player of all time also named his own all-time favourites. The list included UK's George Best, and Brazil's Garrincha and Zico.Pele took Brazil to three World Cup titles scoring 12 goals.
